Reviews.Content: Beautiful Tuscan Villa in Florence In our recent trip to Florence, we have spent some wonderful days at the Park Palace Hotel. When we first saw we were amazed to see this beautiful old Tuscan villa. Surrounded by luxurious vegetation. The personnel was very friendly and helpful with directions and tips to visit Florence. The rooms were large and wonderfully decorated in old Tuscan style. We really appreciated the feeling of being in an old stylish, refined atmosphere. I was very surprised to realise that we could hardly hear the cars passing in the street in front of the hotel. The beds were really comfortable and even my wife that has a back problem slept wonderfully. I definitely recommend a dip in the swimming pool in the shadow of a centenary Lebanon cedar. If you appreciate vegetation you will be happy to find beautiful centenary trees not only in the hotel premises, but also on the streets leading to Florence. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel and the town centre is just 15 minutes away by foot. If you have a car you can also park it for free inside the hotel. The quality was worth the price, and I would return anytime.
Reviews.Author: Luis_alfacinha

Reviews.Content: This could someday be a great place to stay, but beware of it's present condi I booked 2 rooms in this hotel for our very recent rip, relying on the aspect of the pool and outskirts to give us both the feel of staying at a Tuscan country villa while being able to tour and eat in Florence. The last time I was in Florence in late May/early June, it was scorchingly hot and humid so having a pool to cool off in and to have early evening cocktails at was our plan. It was very disappointing and embarrasing to me, since I booked this for the four of us, to arrive and see an empty pool under repair. It was 4:00 PM on a Friday so the thought of getting another cab to take us and our luggage back to town to find another accomodation seemed daunting, so we decided to stay. I negotiated a 30 euro per night per room price reduction with the manager, so that helped. But still, I would have rather booked in town if I had known there was no pool to enjoy.The villa is quite charming in it's decor(, but the exterior gardens were all overgrown and not well tended to. Even if the pool had been operating, there is a huge pine tree (that's been poorly groomed through the years and should be removed) that would have blocked most of the sun.We were given 2 rooms on the top floor and were quite nice. Brand new carpeting, very nice and tasteful brand new bathrooms, comfortable beds with new linens, brand new flat panel TV, and quite roomy. They still have some touches to finish, but it was a nice room as long as you are under 6' tall. There are dormers, especially in the shower, that would make it uncomfortable for a tall person (the lower floor rooms had enormously tall ceilings). We had the room with the only terrace, which I enjoyed. The views, especially south, were very nice and lush. The view of old Florence, however, was not so great. Trees, hills, and buildings blocked the best of it, but you do get to see a sliver of the duomo dome.The other problem was the renovations going on in rooms below, and we heard banging, saws, etc. throughout our stay. Hearing these sounds prior to commiting to stay upon our arrival, I asked if this was going to be continuing through the weekend and Monday holiday, and the manager and attendant both promised it wouldn't. Big lie. Also, the pool repairman showed up early Sunday AM and was making all sorts of racket until 9:00 PM.
Reviews.Author: Jeff2131

Reviews.Content: Lovely people The Park Palace has a lot going for it, lovely friendly staff, a beautiful building, spacious light airy rooms, delightful terrace to sit and eat breakfast. Bus stop outside to get you into Florence about 15 minutes away. Quiet area, no trouble or problems.Sadly all is not wonderful, there is a large tree in the gardens which not only covers three quarters of the pool with shade but also is home to more mosquito's than I would try to count, apart from the vast number of bites my wife and I had to endure. The hotel put mosquito machines with tablets in the rooms, which was kind, but a bit of a giveaway too. We used sprays but these beasts seemed to ignore it. I know you get this problem all over the world, it was very itchy but we still loved the place and the people, out of mosquito season it must be delightful.
Reviews.Author: devonroamer

Reviews.Content: Badly in Need of Renovation This is a grand old villa located just south of Florence. If the owners spent some money to renovate, it would be a beautiful and quiet property. Unfortunately, it has obviously been severely neglected. The pros: lobby and breakfast areas are quite nice, location is quiet, central Florence only about 25 minute walk or 10 minute cab, free parking. The cons: air conditioning is barely functional, rooms are shabby and old, beds are poor. This property is advertised as a 4 star hotel. It warrants 2 stars.
Reviews.Author: CafeBohemia

Reviews.Content: Needs to be renovated When we first arrived, the place looked impressive. It seemed we were in an old Tuscan villa. It had a beautiful entrance and living room with terrace on the main level of the hotel. When we got to our room, however, we were extremely disappointed. The furniture was cheap and old, like from the 60's. The carpet was dirty and it was so hot in the room even though there was an air conditioner but obviously it was not sufficient for the size of room we had. The bathroom was small and the shower OK if you were less than 5' 6''. The breakfast was decent but nothing special. I thought it was barely a 3 star hotel and definitely not a 4 star. I would not stay there again.
Reviews.Author: suziemouse

Reviews.Content: Quiet place but NOT clean Very quiet hotel outside the city center. If you don't have a car or are not willing to take a bus it may prove a problem since there is no restaurant in the hotel. Our main problem was the fact that it was dirty: dead bloody mosquitos on the walls (whose original color was long gone), very old bathroom (1970's style), not very clean (would not step barefoot in the bath tube but I think it was due to its age). Definitely in need of a refurbishment and a good cleaning.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful "VILLA" in Tuscany The hotel was perfect for the price with excellent quality of service. This hotel never purports to be a palace and should not be judged as one. The reviewer from England must have taken the hotel name literally without reading up on any of the information prior to arrival. It is an old villa. And very well kept. All of the advertising says that it was once a private villa. It does not even resemble a palace and never claims to be one. Do not regard the poor review given by a misinformed person. The one from Japan is correct. The bathroom was very clean and the room was large. The furniture and decor should be updated but those are minor points. The staff was helpful and it was nice not to be in the heart of Florence with the throngs of people. It is a hike from the bridge and we took a taxi every time but it was not expensive. It was well-worth the price and we would return without a doubt.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointed Hotel Park PalaceDisappointed........We arrived and entered up the drive to a beautiful palace, our room had no electricity, which was later switched on, only for it to fail early next morning. We were moved to a different room that morning. Hassle you could do without, and should have been checked prior to our visit.The rooms were large but very basic.The reception was the Bar and you drank on the terrace overlooking the gardens  pool.From the outside this palace had so much potential which obviously had not been realised inside.It was only 20 minutes to the Ponte Vecchio however it was not good to walk back late at night as you felt vulnerable, and we always caught a taxi.Needs a refurb!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location For Exploring Tuscany My friend and I stayed in the Park Palace this summer and we thought it was great. We had a corner room on an upper floor so the view was on 2 sides of the room. It was great to look out and see other villas on the hills. The view was really cool. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast room was nice with average food. Eating on the veranda was nice. It is a long walk to the main sights of Florence. We did it once and then took taxis after that. But if you are driving a car and do not want to deal with the traffic in Florence then this is a perfect place to park and not have to deal with getting lost in traffic. ##OH, DO NOT RENT A CAR FROM TRANSHIRE. They ripped us off when we pre-paid for our rental and they told us to take the compact car even though we paid for an Audi A4 or similar. Go through THRIFTY. Trust ONLY American companies. TRANSHIRE IS A DODGY BRITISH company.## Anyway, the hotel is clean. The bathroom was huge with 2 sinks. The airconditioning worked well. And we took day trips to Pisa and San Gimignano (1 day), Sienna and Monteriggioni (1 day), and Castelina in Chianti and MontePulciano (1 day). I would stay there again if I ever went back to Florence.
Reviews.Author: kobekeith

Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel The Park Palace hotel is fantastic. The rooms were wonderful, with a private terrace. The whole place is lovely, a villa that provides a quiet oasis for you to relax after the excitement of Florence. There was a nice, picturesque swimming pool, very refreshing. The breakfast was good, and we ate out on the dining terrace. The staff was very nice and helpful as well.The hotel is a leisurely 1/2-hour walk down into Florence--very scenic. We took a cab back to the hotel at night, which was around 10 or 11 euros (for 4 people). We didn't check out the bus option but knew it was available to us.One caveat: our bed was absolutely terrible. Very mushy and uncomfortable. (I don't mean the mattress wasn't superfirm, I mean it was mushy.) Other than that, the place was so nice that we were tempted to just stay and relax there instead of going into Florence!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Liked it Staying at Park Palace is like experiencing a visit to a Italian villa. It is perched on top of a beautiful hill and is a throw back to another time. The manager (a young woman whose name I wish I wrote down) made the visit work well for us as she went out of her way to help us, and addressed problems directly. The hotel is a 15 minute bus ride from the center of Florence which is good if you want to get out of the traffic in town center. Great place for joggers.Watch out for the taxi drivers in Florence they were the worst in Italy in terms of jacking the rates in anyway they can.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed Park Palace We stayed at Park Palace April 6-9, 2004. From the train station take bus 12 directly to the hotel and bus 13 will take you back to the station. It was a very nice and clean hotel. They had no problem reserving our tickets for the uffizi and academia. The walking path (Lenardo DeVinci ?) is a scenic roughly 1/2 mile walk to the action in Florence. We only took the bus to/from the train station, when we had luggage. The rest of the time we walked. The breakfast was good. If we can get the same rate as last time (92 euro/night), we would definitely stay again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: your own villa March 2004 Staying at the Park Palace was like having your own Italian Villa. It sits up in the hills above Florence and the views from your room are fantastic. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. (This is the first place we stayed in Italy where the staff is constantly asking if there is anything they can do for you.) We walked down to town on a charming winding road and took the bus back. It stops right in front and runs about every 20 min. (You can get bus day passes at the station.)The grounds were lovely, although the pool was not open yet. We got a great rate (80 euros) and we highly recomend it for anyone who wants to get the true feel of the real Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Park Palace Hotel Stay at the Park Palace Hotel if you want a taste of staying at an old Italian Villa at a low price (we got a v good rate (120 euro's a night)at venere). It is a nice 20 minute downhill walk to the Ponte Vecchio  you don't want to walk back up a cab is only 10 Euro's. Rooms are enormous and have a garden view. There is also a pool and a nice communal terrace if your room doesn't have one. Staff are friendly and helpful  breakfast is very good. It is cool and quiet - a nice relief from a day's exhausting sightseeing.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
